Well, if my husband would let me actually experiment with one, that would b=
e the first step LOL!

But what I would try and do is get some kind of veri=
fiable information from the "entity" that I contact with the board to prove=
 that it is communication from an actual, intelligent being and not just my=
 own motor responses making he planchette move. It would have to be informa=
tion that I have no knowledge of.

If I could do that, and consistently, th=
en I would be comfortable saying that I am actually talking to a spirit.

T=
he reason I have my doubts is that you have to be touching the planchette t=
o get it to move. If it were an actual spirit, I would think that shouldn't=
 be necessary. We all know ghosts can a do move objects.

But this brings u=
p another mystery - if the Ouija board is actual spirit communication, mayb=
e there is a difference between the entities you can contact with it and yo=
ur common ghost.

April

  When it come=

  I agree that we all have the ability for extra sensory perce=

We all can run, but some are naturally better at it. Still, with practice w=
e can get better.

  But that is not my aim with the Ouija.

    April~
     
    You forgo=
t yawn from boredom, that's what I do.
     
    Use it, don't use it.  I d=
on't care.  But why bother.  When people ask me I usually suggest that if t=
hey want to communicate with ... whatever why not develop the ability yours=
elf.  - ya, I'm one of those who believe anyone can.
     
    There's alwa=
ys the question in the back of your mind whether your partner's moving it. =
 The intentions of "what" you are talking to.  Not to mention it's too slow=
 and limited.
     
    Besides if you take the time to develop the ability=
 you can get more texture in the information.  Asking the board "where you =
married?" may get you a "yes" but a psychic might get the sense of a religi=
ous or civil ceremonhy, the garment(s) worn, other's in the party, or wheth=
er that Being approved/disapproved of their spouse (ie was it a reluctant u=
nion).
     
    ~Lori
